statement.p: Consider the radioactive decay model for Ytterbium-169: \displaystyle{A}={46.7}{\left(\frac{{1}}{{2}}\right)}^{{{t}{/}{32.01}}}
where \displaystyle{t} is in units of days.
What is the annual percent increase or decrease?
Use 365 days/year, 8760 hours per year, and 525600 minutes per year.

solution.p: The initial amount is the coefficient in front, because when \displaystyle{t}={0} the second factor is just one. So the initial amount is 46.7.
To obtain the annual percent decrease, we need to convert the units to years. 32.01 days is \displaystyle\frac{{32.01}}{{365}}={0.087698630136986} years.

Next we need to convert to the form \displaystyle{\left({1}+{p}\right)}^{{t}}. We can do this by expanding \displaystyle{\left(\frac{{1}}{{2}}\right)}^{{\frac{{t}}{{0.087698630136986}}}}={\left({\left(\frac{{1}}{{2}}\right)}^{{\frac{{1}}{{0.087698630136986}}}}\right)}^{{t}}={0.00036935950885786}^{{t}}. Now we can calculate the percent decrease as \displaystyle{1}-{0.00036935950885786}={0.99963064049114}. Converting to percent this is \displaystyle{100}{\left({0.99963064049114}\right)}={99.963064049114}\%.
